item.description:
Note: Please check this page frequently for updates and always remember to refresh the page.
Date Lesson Slides Reading Lab HW Project WEEK 1 Tue, Aug 27 Introduction to course PART I: MULTIPLE LINEAR REGRESSION Thur, Aug 29 Introduction to multiple linear regression WEEK 2 Tue, Sept 3 Model assessment, diagnostics and validation Thur, Sept 5 Model building and selection Fri, Sept 6 Lab 1: WEEK 3 Tue, Sept 10 Transformations, multicollinearity and heteroscedasticity Thur, Sept 12 Case studies 1 PART II: GENERALIZED LINEAR MODELS WEEK 4 Tue, Sept 17 Introduction to logistic regression Thur, Sept 19 Logistic regression: inference vs prediction Fri, Sept 20 Lab 2: WEEK 5 Tue, Sept 24 Logistic regression: model assessment and validation Thur, Sept 26 Multinomial logistic regression WEEK 6 Tue, Oct 1 Poisson regression Thur, Oct 3 Probit regression Fri, Oct 4 Lab 3: Team project 1 presentations WEEK 7 Tue, Oct 8 No class: fall break Thur, Oct 10 Case studies 2 PART III: MULTILEVEL/HIERARCHICAL MODELS WEEK 8 Tue, Oct 15 Multilevel linear models I Thur, Oct 17 Multilevel linear models II Fri, Oct 18 Lab 4: WEEK 9 Tue, Oct 22 Multilevel logistic regression Thur, Oct 24 Case studies 3 PART IV: DEALING WITH MESSY DATA WEEK 10 Tue, Oct 29 Missing values, errors, and outliers; single imputation methods Thur, Oct 31 Multiple imputation Fri, Nov 1 Lab 5: Team project 2 presentations PART V: METHODS FOR CAUSAL INFERENCE WEEK 11 Final project proposal due Tue, Nov 5 Association vs.

item.title: Policies
item.description: Prerequisites Students are expected to know all topics covered in the MIDS summer course review and boot camp. These include basic probability (including conditional probability, expectations and common probability distributions), and statistical inference (including hypothesis testing, confidence intervals, linear regression with one predictor, and exploratory data analysis). Students are also expected to be familiar with R/Rstudio. Due to space constraints, the course is open only to students in the MIDS program.
